sentences.en: 'But the world itself is only a speck of dust.
sentences.cn: “ 但是世界本身只是一粒尘埃.

sentences.en: A very small piece or part; a tiny portion or speck.
sentences.cn: 微粒非常小的块或部分; 一小份儿或一小点儿.

sentences.en: Billy leaned forward and brushed a speck of dust off his shoes.
sentences.cn: 比利俯身擦掉了鞋子上的一丝灰尘。

sentences.en: Breathe in the love instilled into this speck of time and creation.
sentences.cn: 吸进溶于此时此刻的万物之爱.

sentences.en: He flipped a speck of dust off.
He has even cut himself shaving. There is a speck of blood by his ear.
sentences.cn: 他甚至在刮脸时划伤了自己。他耳边有一点血迹。

sentences.en: He rejoices at every speck of dust that receives it and lives.
sentences.cn: 他为所容纳而又让其生存的每一粒灰尘而高兴.

sentences.en: He sees a speck or two in the valley.
sentences.cn: 他看到了山谷中有一、两处斑点.

sentences.en: I've got a speck of dirt on my shirt.
sentences.cn: 我的衬衫上有一点污垢.

sentences.en: I've got a speck of dust in my eye.
sentences.cn: 我眼睛里弄进了一粒灰尘.

sentences.en: Not a speck of cloud is to be seen.
Now you put a speck of orange juice in the water.
sentences.cn: 现在你在水里放一点点橘子汁.

sentences.en: Shirley flicked a speck of fluff from the sleeve of her black suit.
sentences.cn: 雪莉弹掉了黑色套装袖子上的一点小绒毛。

sentences.en: The moon would be a speck the size of a small pea.
sentences.cn: 月亮是豆子般的一颗小粒.

sentences.en: The speck would be jarred into more erratic motion.
sentences.cn: 微粒将受到更为反复无常的冲击.

sentences.en: Wash the speck out without injury to your eyes.
sentences.cn: 把微粒洗出来,但不能损伤眼睛.

words.tran_cn: 有斑点的；如斑点般散布的
点缀（speckle的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tran_en: a very small mark, spot, or piece of something
